ygData.subject: Re: How in the world do you stack? I don't think stacking works at all . . .
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Actually, the Restoraton song does continue after you stop singing it, so by twisting it into your combat as say 1 or 3 songs meshed together, you ll be
ygData.messageBody:
> Well 2 songs is one thing, but I used to stack 3 songs sometimes.
> Well, some bards do it, but I don't normally stack or twist Hymn of
>
> Restoration during combat. Usually I'll stack something that has an
> on-going
> effect like Whistling Warsong and Anthem (both of those effects are
> on-going
> as long as the icon is there). You get a pretty nice boost to stats
> while
> they are both there. Try stacking them and check your stats. I also
> threw in
> that song that lowers mob attack speed (i like that one)..I think
> it's level
> 21 song? Don't remember the name of it.

Actually, the Restoraton song does continue after you stop singing
it, so by twisting it into your combat as say 1 or 3 songs meshed
together, you'll be healing for 4 hits per round instead of just 1
(at 12th and 13th that is). At lower levels you'd be healing for the
3 points, and I think it goes higher at upper levels. I have been
twisting Anthem, Bellow, and then Restoration together quite
successfully.

Tigsen
